table.name: keyfigure

row.name: fk_object_type_id
row.comment: Foreign Key for definition of the type of object

table.comment: Named keyfigures/measures with description and if possible with a formular (pseudo code formular) or SQL or MDX statement.

table.name: object_type
table.comment: Types of objects - used for the mappings (keyfigures, sourcesystems, ...)

table.name: client
table.comment: Client information

table.name: project
table.comment: Project information for a specific client

table.name: sourcesystem
table.comment: Quellsystem

table.name: data_delivery_object
table.comment: German = Datenliefergegenstand This is an object which provides data for exporting out of an dispositive system such a data warehouse. This is only meant for delivery, not for using a data source. Examples: Report, flatfile export, view with external access...,

table.name: tool
table.comment: BI or DWH tool which is used to do the job e.g. Report, ETL, DQ, OLAP...

table.name: object_depends_on
table.comment: Abhängigkeit zu Objecten

table.name: attribute
table.comment: Kennzeichen - zB Wenn Feld im ersten Zeichen ein A ernthaelt, dann ist es ein besonderer Artikel...

table.name: tool_type
table.comment: Welcher Typ ist das Programm: Reporting, Dataquality, ETL, Semantic-Layer, Scheduler, Portal, Dashboard, DBMS, OLAP

table.name: db_table
table.comment: Database table

row.name: bulk_load_checksum
row.comment: checksum from bulk load with kettle pdi

table.name: db_table_context
table.comment: Which kind of table is it in a BI context? (staging table, temp, fact, datamart, dimension, ...)

table.name: db_database
table.comment: Generic information which databases is used in context (vendor database, name of the database, kind of use (production, test, dev, ...), IP, type (operational, reporting, analytical, dwh), database-technologie (OLTP, OLAP, NoSQL, ...)

table.name: scheduling
table.comment: Scheduling of BI items (report bursting, copy of files, ETL-jobs, ...)

table.name: parameter
table.comment: Parameter which can be set e.g. on report execution, scheduling, ETL jobs, ...

table.name: db_table_type
table.comment: Typ der Tabelle: Normale Tabelle, View, CSV Datei, XML-Datei, SOAP Methode

table.name: object_comment

row.name: ref_fk_object_type_id
row.comment: Dies ist das referenzierte Objekt-Typ ID

table.comment: Kommentar zu dem Object

table.name: glossary
table.comment: Glosar für Projektspezifische Begriffe oder Eigennamen

table.name: data_delivery_type
table.comment: Which types: e.g. report, flatfile export, view, REST or SOAP WebService, ...

table.name: data_transfer_process

row.name: source_internal_object_id
row.comment: Internal ID from the object of the source (e.g. the objectId of a PROCEDURE in a RDBMS)

table.comment: This is an object for describing a data transfer oder data manipulation such as ETL, Script, SQL query, ...

table.name: data_transfer_type
table.comment: Lookup-List for data transfer processef to describe the kind

table.name: app_config
table.comment: Applikationsconfigutation

table.name: contact_group
table.comment: Kontaktgruppe (Abteilung, Team, ...)

table.name: contact
table.comment: Einzelner Kontakt oder Ansprechpartner

table.name: bracket
table.comment: Defines same objectvalues with different names. E.g. tablefield named Country and CNTRY are spelled different but has the same content and meaning

table.name: bracket_searchPattern
table.comment: SearchPattern for collecting bracket elements

table.name: import_stage_db_table
table.comment: Import table for bulk upload

table.name: perspective_filter
table.comment: This table holds the data for filtering on object_types on selected persective (language)

table.name: mapping_qualifier

row.name: short_name
row.comment: Short name. Useful for printing in diagrams

row.name: needs_object_depends_on
row.comment: Some objekt links belongs to a parent/child relashionship.

table.comment: More details about the relationship between two objects

table.name: url
table.comment: Holds Links to webpages or files or JDBC Connections, etc. Are used for mapping_objects_2_objects only.

table.name: cleanup_queue
table.comment: This table holds temporary items to be cleaned up

table.name: deleted_status
table.comment: Indicates a soft delete: E.g. deleted on source system or by user (before hard deleted in the object table)

table.name: object_persistence_method

row.name: name
row.comment: added with bulk loader, added with copy&paste, copy, symlink, ....

table.comment: In which context is the object beeing created (copied, symlink, ...)

table.name: datamanagement_process

row.name: name
row.comment: Frontend/User, Bulkloader, Copy&Paste Import, Frontend/Copy, Frontend/Symlink, ...

row.name: routine
row.comment: Name of the routine (e.g. Kettle Transformation / Yii2 name of functionm, ....)

table.comment: Which process/module/tool inserted/updated/copied/... the row

table.name: map_object_2_tag
table.comment: Mapping for tagged objects

row.name: sink_is_also_sourcesystem
row.comment: if True, then fk_sourcesystem_id must be set

row.name: fk_sourcesystem_id
row.comment: only if sink_is_also_sourcesystem is set to TRUE

row.name: scope
row.comment: if client, all objects within a project can be used

row.name: name
row.comment: Name of the landscape (will be shown as title)

row.name: name
row.comment: The "link" can also have a name (e.g. 2FA Auth or VPN only, a.s.o)

row.name: fk_tool_id
row.comment: optional, for naming something like Apache Hop, Azure Datafactory, Apache Beam, Google Dataflow, Airflow DAG, ...
